thread.title: No More Rabbit Holes: A Skin Type Quiz to Change Lives
thread.title_full: No More Rabbit Holes: A Skin Type Quiz to Change Lives

author: Ellen Maistrenko
title: No More Rabbit Holes: A Skin Type Quiz to Change Lives
text:
Your skin can communicate. All it takes is to learn the simple language!
Your skin type is definitive when it comes to combining an ideal care routine. No amount of branded and high-quality products won’t work their magic on your complexion if they are designed for other types of skin than yours. Is it oily, dry, or normal? It is time to unveil some secrets that your skin has to tell you! That is a quick and entertaining skin type quiz, and get to know your skin on a first-name basis!
Take This What Is My Skin Type Quiz and Perfect Your Care Routine What’s Your Skin Type? Quiz
Wondering whether your skin is oily, dry, combination, sensitive, or normal? Answer 10 quick questions to discover your true skin type — and get product tips tailored just for you!
1 / 10
1. How does your skin feel a few hours after washing your face (with no products)?
Dry or flaky in some areas Easily irritated or tight Shiny, especially on the T-zone Comfortable, balanced Tight and flaky all over 2 / 10
2. What does your skin look like in the morning?
Shiny, especially on the T-zShiny, especially in the T-zoneone Some oily spots and dry patches Dull or dry all over Slightly flushed or patchy Fresh and balanced 3 / 10
3. How often do you experience breakouts?
In oily zones only Frequently, especially in the T-zone Occasionally, especially when stressed or reacting to products Rarely Hardly ever, but some dry spots clog 4 / 10
4. How are your pores?
Large, especially around nose/forehead Small and tight Noticeable in oily areas only Small, but sometimes inflamed Not very noticeable 5 / 10
5. How does your skin behave in cold weather?
Slightly drier, but still balanced Feels normal or even oilier Gets red, itchy, or inflamed Cheeks dry, T-zone stays normal Becomes tight and flaky 6 / 10
6. How does your skin behave in humid weather?
T-zone becomes oily, rest stays the same May react with redness or itchiness A bit more glowy, but still balanced Slightly more hydrated, but never oily Becomes shiny and prone to clogged pores 7 / 10
7. Do you need to reapply moisturizer during the day?
Yes, skin dries out quickly Yes, if skin reacts or feels tight Only on certain areas (like cheeks) Not really No, my skin stays oily enough 8 / 10
8. How does your skin react to sun exposure?
Burns or turns red easily Tans evenly with light SPF Feels irritated and drier T-zone gets shiny, cheeks stay dry Gets greasy and may break out 9 / 10
9. How does your skin react to new skincare products?
Some products clog pores or dry out areas Often feels more dry or irritated Usually fine with most Redness, burning, or irritation is common Products often feel too heavy or cause breakouts 10 / 10
10. What does your skin feel like by midday?
Oily on forehead/nose, dry on cheeks Slightly itchy or reactive Still comfortable Greasy or shiny all over Tight or flaky Did you receive your fair share of insight into your skin type? You can use these tips to improve your care regimen instantly. However, a consultation with a certified cosmetologist will provide you with more information on how to perfect the routine and let your complexion radiate health!
